intro: Ipheion porrifolium, commonly known as the white-flowered groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a low-growing perennial with narrow, grass-like leaves and small, daisy-like white flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. It typically thrives in well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. Its botanical features make it a notable species in native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
